SEARCH
Package controller

Class AuthenticationController

Object
AuthenticationController
All Implemented Interfaces:
AuthenticationService
public class AuthenticationController extends Object implements AuthenticationService
Controller responsible for handling user authentication-related operations such as login, logout, password changes, and user management.

  • Constructor Details

    • AuthenticationController

      public AuthenticationController()
      Constructor to initialize the AuthenticationController with the necessary repositories.

  • Method Details

    • clearAllUsers

      public void clearAllUsers()
      Clears all users from the repositories and resets the current user.

    • addUser

      public void addUser(User user)
      Adds a new user (Patient or Staff) to the appropriate repository. If the user is a Patient, they are added to the patient repository, otherwise to the staff repository.
      Parameters:
      user - The user to be added to the repository.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the user is null.

    • login

      public User login(String hospitalId, String password)
      Logs in a user using their hospital ID and password. The system first checks the staff repository and then the patient repository.
      Specified by:
      login in interface AuthenticationService
      Parameters:
      hospitalId - The hospital ID of the user.
      password - The password provided by the user.
      Returns:
      The logged-in User if credentials are correct, or null if login fails.

    • changePassword

      public boolean changePassword(User user, String oldPassword, String newPassword)
      Changes the password for a user, provided the old password matches the current one. The password change is only applied if successful.
      Specified by:
      changePassword in interface AuthenticationService
      Parameters:
      user - The user whose password is being changed.
      oldPassword - The current password of the user.
      newPassword - The new password to set for the user.
      Returns:
      true if the password was successfully changed, false otherwise.

    • getCurrentUser

      public User getCurrentUser()
      Retrieves the currently logged-in user.
      Returns:
      The current User if logged in, or null if no user is logged in.

    • logout

      public void logout()
      Logs out the current user by setting the currentUser to null.

    • isLoggedIn

      public boolean isLoggedIn()
      Checks if a user is currently logged in.
      Returns:
      true if a user is logged in, false otherwise.

    • getUserType

      public String getUserType()
      Gets the type of the current logged-in user, such as "Doctor", "Patient", etc.
      Returns:
      A string representing the type of the current user, or null if no user is logged in.

    • userExists

      public boolean userExists(String hospitalId)
      Checks if a user exists in either the staff or patient repositories.
      Parameters:
      hospitalId - The hospital ID to check for existence.
      Returns:
      true if the user exists, false otherwise.

    • removeUser

      public boolean removeUser(String hospitalId)
      Removes a user from either the staff or patient repository.
      Parameters:
      hospitalId - The hospital ID of the user to be removed.
      Returns:
      true if the user was successfully removed, false otherwise.

    • getUser

      public Optional<User> getUser(String hospitalId)
      Retrieves a user (either staff or patient) by their hospital ID.
      Parameters:
      hospitalId - The hospital ID of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the User if found, or empty if no user exists with the given ID.

    • resetPassword

      public boolean resetPassword(String hospitalId)
      Resets the password of a user to a default password ("password"). This is typically used for password recovery or reset purposes.
      Parameters:
      hospitalId - The hospital ID of the user whose password is to be reset.
      Returns:
      true if the password was successfully reset, false if the user was not found.
